intro: Jatropha pavoniana, commonly known as the purple leaf jatropha, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking purple foliage and yellow-orange flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The plant produces capsule fruits containing toxic seeds, which are a key feature of the genus Jatropha. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice in landscaping.
